title: Improving Your Soil One Amendment at a Time | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Conducting soil testing and preparations for a garden.
subtasks: Researching the organic matter content in garden soil.
Identifying appropriate organic materials for soil amendment (e.g., compost, manure, peat moss, straw).
Applying organic matter (about two inches) to the garden site.
Raking the organic matter into the soil surface.
Using a rototiller to incorporate the organic matter at maximum depth feasible.
Selecting and applying fertilizers based on nutrient deficiencies.
Preparing the garden for the upcoming season by addressing soil structure and nutrient content.

tasks.task: Managing organic and inorganic soil amendments.
subtasks: Measuring and distributing two inches of organic matter across the garden.
Incorporating materials into the soil using a rake.
Utilizing a rototiller to thoroughly mix organic materials into the soil.
Identifying nutrient deficiencies in the soil.
Choosing suitable fertilizers to address these deficiencies.
Applying the selected fertilizers to the garden as per product instructions.
